required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Ethnic/Racial Differences in Metabolism and DNA Adduct Formation
clinical_study.official_title: Ethnic/Racial Differences in Metabolism and DNA Adduct Formation by 1,3-butadiene

lead_sponsor.agency: Masonic Cancer Center, University of Minnesota

clinical_study.source: Masonic Cancer Center, University of Minnesota

brief_summary.textblock: The study will investigate the role of 1,3-butadiene metabolic activation and deactivation in lung cancer risk among various ethnic/racial groups. This project will require urine samples from smokers and nonsmokers from the three ethnic/racial groups recruited by the Clinical and Biomarker Core for the analysis of 1,3-butadiene DNA adducts. Data on nicotine intake (urinary TNE) in these subjects as well as in 400 lung cancer cases and 400 controls from Project 1 will be also required for this project.

primary_outcome.measure: Butadiene-DNA adducts in different ethnic groups
primary_outcome.description: Investigate ethnic differences in butadiene-DNA adducts in smokers belonging to different ethnic groups.

primary_outcome.measure: Butadiene-DNA adduct load in smokers with lung cancer
primary_outcome.description: Investigate the association between butadiene-DNA adduct load and lung cancer development in smokers.
Examine how polymorphisms of carcinogen metabolizing genes influence metabolic inactivation, DNA adduct formation/repair, and toxicity of butadiene-derived epoxides.

arm_group.description: Two parents of non-Hispanic white descent
At least one parent of Hawaiian descent

intervention.description: One to two home visits where tobacco use and medical history and biological samples will be collected including blood, buccal cells and urine

study_pop.textblock: Approximately 300 smokers will be recruited from the Multiethnic Cohort (MEC) study or the general population in Hawai'i

overall_official.affiliation: University of Minnesota, Department of Psychiatry
